result.execSummary:
All charges against Noah Wesley Garland in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Noah Wesley Garland is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah Wesley Garland

records.addlTxt:
NOH (ARGN) returned by PO. Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward. olg
Per jail: DE no longer in custody. Not resent, as hearing date has passed. Filed in 22CF379, 22CF881, 22CF451, and 22CF452. olg
Per SRN.  F: Dispatch, Jail, & SCSO. bph

9:32 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Noah Wesley Garland appeared by video, in custody in Pierce Co Jail.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Noah Wesley Garland. Includes 22CF379, 22CF451, 22CF452- all 3 set for PH and 21CF881 (STC).  Court reviews files and questions Atty Firkus on continuing with todays hearing with DE appearing via zoom or if he prefers to reschedule. Atty Firkus requesting clients input. DE would like to proceed with today's hearing but would like to talk to Atty Firkus first.  Court requests everyone to leave court room to allow time for DE to speak with his Atty in private.  Off Record at 9:40 AM. Back on at 9:47 AM.  Atty Firkus is ready to proceed with today's hearings. DE is ready to proceed.  Court finds DE freely and voluntarily waives right to personal appearance for today's proceeding. Court first calls 22CF379- S/T of Officer Charles Welbourn of HUPD.  Direct by ADA Rockow.  ADA Rockow requests for Court to take Judicial Notice of bond in 21CF881.  For purposes of Prelim only court takes Judicial Notice of bond in 21CF881.  Cross by Atty Firkus. Redirect by ADA Rockow.  Recross by Atty Firkus.  Atty arguments.  Court makes statements. Court dismisses 22CF379 without prejudice.  Court calls 22CF451 next.  S/T of Officer Alex Vansomeren of HUPD.  Direct by ADA Rockow.  ADA Rockow requests Court to take Judicial Notice of bonds in 18CF429 & 21CF881.  Court takes Judicial Notice of both bonds for purposes of today's hearing. Cross by Atty Firkus.  Atty Firkus gives argument. For 22CF451- Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court calls 22CF452.  S/T of Sgt Anthony VanSomeren of SCSO.  Direct by ADA Rockow.  ADA Rockow requesting court take Judicial Notice of bonds in 18CF429 & 21CF881.  Court takes Judicial Notice of both bonds for purposes of today's hearing. Cross by Atty Firkus. For 22CF452- Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court will allow DE to appear by zoom for next hearing. Atty Firkus approved to appear by zoom.  Court recalls case at 10:29 AM- Court QUASHES any and all WARRANTS. 
Arraignment scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Letter to Judge Needham from ADA Rockow requesting continuance of 8/9/22 PH.  gll   to kp 8/8
Includes 21CF881, 22CF379, 22CF451, 22CF452. Body only. Adjoining States. Signed by SRN 8/3/22. ec: attys, c: SCSO.  gll

4:04 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Noah Wesley Garland not in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Noah Wesley Garland. Includes 21CF881 set for STC, 22CF0379, 22CF451, & 22CF452- all 3 files set for PH. Court reviews file and notes 3 Officers in court for today's proceedings.  Atty Firkus states DE is in Pierce County Jail.  Court issues WARRANT on all files, will set for PH to have DE transported here. ADA Rockow to get Order for Transport filed as soon as possible. Adjourned at 4:10 AM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: filed by Travis Satorius; hereby appointing Atty D. Firkus. arc
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

8:27 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Noah Wesley Garland in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Noah Wesley Garland.  Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF881 & 22CF379.  Court reviews file. DE does qualify for PD should contact their office so Atty Firkus could potentially be appointed to case.  Atty Firkus states there is no resolution at this time, requesting to schedule a PH on new case. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues.  State requesting to test at JSC today since he missed last week. Court will not make DE test today.  Off Record- DE contacted PD's office, he does qualify and they will give Atty Firkus a call to see if he will take the appointment. 
 Adjourned at 8:37 AM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Supplemental Report- JSC. Includes 21CF881 and 22CF379. Filed by Tina S. arc
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. SEALED. km         to js
Status conference on July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:00 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:   Erica Ellenwood and Intern Connor Smith,  DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Noah Wesley Garland appeared from jail. DE qualifies for public defender. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights.   Waives reading. State requests bond. Court sets bond. Court administratively transfers to Branch 3. Time limits waived. Atty. Dolfi states that Atty. Firkus represents DE on underlying case as court appointment. Court sets STC in Branch 3. Adjourned: 1:17 PM. kma  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
